basics.name: Kurt Nikaitani
basics.label: Student/IT Professional
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of    Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2018. I also have a background in Biology (B.S.).

work.summary: On-site IT for hotel. Work closely with a remote team on issues.
highlights: Maintain and provide support for two different domains
Install and troubleshoot software, printers, and networking issues
Consult staff on tech related purchases and implementation
Troubleshoot software, hardware and networking issues over the phone
Answer phone and email responses to the ITS Help Desk

volunteer.organization: Enterprise Technology Services, State of Hawaii
volunteer.summary: Developed website for the first Hawaii Annual Code Challenge - http://hacc.hawaii.gov/
highlights: Increased proficiency in HTML, CSS, PHP, and JS
Presented weekly status updates to state staff and worked closely with other interns to build the event from the ground up

volunteer.organization: John A Burns School of Medicine, University of Hawaii
volunteer.summary: Assisted with development and debugging of a pain assessment application on the Android platform
highlights: Worked with a small team to debug and improve application

volunteer.summary: Designed and implemented BLVCKMVGIC which allows users to send messages or data hidden within photos. We are currently redesigning the application to utilize PGP encryption instead of RSA.
highlights: Gained experience in Swift, cryptography, and steganography
